com.communote.server.core.mail.messages

Class MailMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.communote.server.core.mail.messages.MailMessage
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActivateUserForManagerMailMessage, ActivateUserMailMessage, BlogNameIdMissingInSubjectMailMessage, BlogsNotFoundMailMessage, ContentProcessingErrorMailMessage, DirectMessageMissingRecipientMailMessage, GenericErrorMailMessage, GenericMailMessage, ManagerSecurityWarnMailMessage, NewUserConfirmedForManagerMessage, NoteLimitReachedMailMessage, NotifyAboutCRCSizeLimitReachedMailMessage, NotifyAboutNoteMailMessage, NotifyUserCountLimitReachedMailMessage, NoWriteAccessToBlogMailMessage, RemindUserLoginMailMessage, SecurityCodeMailMessage, TextMailMessage, UserNotInClientMailMessage, WarningMailMessage

    public abstract class MailMessage
extends Object
    An abstract base class for all mail messages. Subclasses can define templates for the content and subject of the mail and can provide data to be available when the templates are rendered.
    Author:
    Communote team - http://communote.github.io/

    • Constructor Detail

      • MailMessage

        public MailMessage(String messageKey,
                   Locale locale,
                   User... recipients)
        Construct a new message. Content and subject templates will be retrieved from the ResourceBundleManager.
        Parameters:
        messageKey - Key of the message to get from the ResourceBundleManager and use as content template. The key will be returned by getContentTemplateId(). The key of the message to use as the subject template is derived from the messageKey by appending .subject to it.
        locale - the locale to use when getting the templates from the ResourceBundleManager
        recipients - A list of recipients of this message. The email addresses will be added to the TO header.

      • MailMessage

        public MailMessage(String messageKey,
                   Locale locale,
                   Collection<User> recipients)
        Construct a new message. Content and subject templates will be retrieved from the ResourceBundleManager.
        Parameters:
        messageKey - Key of the message to get from the ResourceBundleManager and use as content template. The key will be returned by getContentTemplateId(). The key of the message to use as the subject template is derived from the messageKey by appending .subject to it.
        locale - the locale to use when getting the templates from the ResourceBundleManager
        recipients - A list of recipients of this message. The email addresses will be added to the TO header.

      • MailMessage

        public MailMessage(String messageKey,
                   Map<String,String> templatePlaceholderMessageKeys,
                   Locale locale,
                   User... recipients)
        Construct a new message. Content and subject templates will be retrieved from the ResourceBundleManager.
        Parameters:
        messageKey - Key of the message to get from the ResourceBundleManager and use as content template. The key will be returned by getContentTemplateId(). The key of the message to use as the subject template is derived from the messageKey by appending .subject to it.
        templatePlaceholderMessageKeys - A mapping of placeholders to message keys, which will be replaced within the template with the loaded message. Use it in the template @@placeholder@@.
        locale - the locale to use when getting the templates from the ResourceBundleManager
        recipients - A list of recipients of this message. The email addresses will be added to the TO header.

      • MailMessage

        public MailMessage(String messageKey,
                   Map<String,String> templatePlaceholderMessageKeys,
                   Locale locale,
                   Collection<User> recipients)
        Construct a new message. Content and subject templates will be retrieved from the ResourceBundleManager.
        Parameters:
        messageKey - Key of the message to get from the ResourceBundleManager and use as content template. The key will be returned by getContentTemplateId(). The key of the message to use as the subject template is derived from the messageKey by appending .subject to it.
        templatePlaceholderMessageKeys - A mapping of placeholders to message keys, which will be replaced within the template with the loaded message. Use it in the template @@placeholder@@.
        locale - the locale to use when getting the templates from the ResourceBundleManager
        recipients - A list of recipients of this message. The email addresses will be added to the TO header.

    • Method Detail

      • addBcc

        public void addBcc(User user)
        Add a recipient of the email. The email address of the user will be added to the BCC header.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to send the mail to

      • addCc

        public void addCc(User user)
        Add a recipient of the email. The email address of the user will be added to the CC header.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to send the mail to

      • addTo

        public void addTo(User user)
        Add a recipient of the email. The email address of the user will be added to the TO header.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to send the mail to

      • addTo

        public void addTo(String emailAddress)
        Add a recipient of the email. The email address will be added to the TO header.
        Parameters:
        emailAddress - the email address of the recipient

      • addTo

        public void addTo(String emailAddress,
                  String personalName)
        Add a recipient of the email. The email address will be added to the TO header.
        Parameters:
        emailAddress - the email address of the recipient
        personalName - the personal name to add to the TO header.

      • getBcc

        public Collection<User> getBcc()
        Returns:
        a possibly empty collection of all users whose email addresses should be added to the BCC header

      • getCc

        public Collection<User> getCc()
        Returns:
        a possibly empty collection of all users whose email addresses should be added to the CC header

      • getContentTemplate

        public String getContentTemplate()
        Returns:
        the template for rendering the content of the mail message

      • getContentTemplateId

        public String getContentTemplateId()
        Returns:
        an ID of the content template

      • getFromAddress

        public String getFromAddress()
        Get the email address of the sender.
        If no address has been set the configured address of the Communote installation will be returned.
        Returns:
        the email address to be used in the From header

      • getFromAddressName

        public String getFromAddressName()
        Get the personal name of the sender.
        If no name has been set the configured name of the Communote installation will be returned.
        Returns:
        the sender name to be used in the From header

      • getGlobalModel

        public Map<String,Object> getGlobalModel()
        Model of key-value pairs with common data useful for all mail messages. The model will be passed to prepareModel(Map) where it can be extended with specific data before handing it over to the template rendering engine.
        Returns:
        the model

      • getLocale

        public Locale getLocale()
        Returns:
        the locale

      • getMessageIdentifier

        public String getMessageIdentifier()
        Returns an identifier of the message which can be used in the Message-ID header. The identifier must be unique and must fulfill the dot-atom-text pattern of rfc2822. The identifier will extended to become a syntactically correct Message-ID header field value.
        Returns:
        the message identifier or null if no specific Message-ID header should be set

      • getReplyToAddress

        public String getReplyToAddress()
        Returns a string holding the email address to be used in the "reply-to" header. The default implementation returns an address defined for the current client. If null is returned, the "reply-to" header should not be set.
        Returns:
        the email address to add to the reply-to header, can be null

      • getReplyToAddressName

        public String getReplyToAddressName()
        Returns the personal name to be used in the "reply-to" header field.
        Returns:
        the personal name

      • getSubjectTemplate

        public String getSubjectTemplate()
        Returns:
        the template for rendering the subject of the mail message

      • getSubjectTemplateId

        public String getSubjectTemplateId()
        Returns:
        an ID of the subject template

      • getTo

        public Collection<User> getTo()
        Returns:
        a possibly empty collection of all users whose email addresses should be added to the TO header

      • getToAddresses

        public Collection<String> getToAddresses()
        Returns:
        a possibly empty collection of email addresses which should be added to the TO header. This doesn't include the email addresses of the users returned by getTo(), instead only the addresses added with addTo(String) or addTo(String, String) are returned.

      • getToAddressPersonalName

        public String getToAddressPersonalName(String emailAddress)
        Return a personal name which was added with an email address by invoking addTo(String, String).
        Parameters:
        emailAddress - the email address for which the personal name should be returned
        Returns:
        the personal name added with the email address or null if no personal name was added or the email address wasn't added

      • isHtmlMail

        public boolean isHtmlMail()
        States whether the underlying mail content template produces an HTML mail or not.
        Returns:
        True if the mail template produces HTML

      • isInsertRecipientPersonalName

        public boolean isInsertRecipientPersonalName()
        Returns:
        whether to insert the personal name (first name, last name and salutation if available) of a recipient to the TO, CC or BCC header. By default the personal name is not added.

      • prepareModel

        public abstract void prepareModel(Map<String,Object> model)
        Prepare a model of key-value pairs which will be passed to the template engine when the content and subject templates should be rendered.
        Parameters:
        model - The model to prepare. It will be initialized with the settings returned by getGlobalModel().

      • setFromAddress

        public void setFromAddress(String fromAddress)
        Set the email address of sender.
        Note: be careful when setting an address because the domain part of the address should normally not leave the domain of the outgoing email server.
        Parameters:
        fromAddress - the email address to be used in From header

      • setFromAddressName

        public void setFromAddressName(String fromAddressName)
        Set the personal name of the sender.
        Parameters:
        fromAddressName - the name of the sender to be used in the From header

      • setInsertRecipientPersonalName

        public void setInsertRecipientPersonalName(boolean insertRecipientPersonalName)
        Define whether the personal name (first name, last name and salutation if available) of a recipient should be added to the TO, CC or BCC headers.
        Parameters:
        insertRecipientPersonalName - true to insert the personal name, false otherwise
